rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The verb 'reported' is neutral. 'critically ill' is a factual description of condition.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The verb 'has reported' is not on the moderate verb list.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: Reports negative facts (cases, deaths, critical illness) without explicit calming language.
statement_text: China has reported 21 human infections with the H5N6 subtype of avian influenza in 2021 to the World Health Organization, compared with only five last year, it [China] said, with six dead and many of the others critically ill.

rationale: Segment contains 'only five last year'. 'only' is a minimiser, but 'last year' provides temporal contrast, not a scale contrast against a total population or denominator.

rationale: Reports case numbers and severity, not capability/preparedness.
